titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Ben Underwood, Judgment
CWG7108

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky Jessamine Circuit Court Sct
At a Circuit Court for Jessamine County on the 6th day of March 1865 --
Commonwealth Plaintiff
against } Indictment No 2
Ben Underwood Defendant

The defendant Ben Underwood altho duly summoned and recognized to appear came not but made default -- It is therefore adjudged by the Court that said Ben Underwood make good his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of sixty dollars and also her costs herein expended and that he betoken therefor, And the defendant Ben Underwood failing to appear herein according to his recognizance entered into by him -- said recognizance is adjuged by the Court forfeited and it is ordered that a summons issue against the surety in said recognizance returnable to the 1st day ^of^ the next term of the Court to show cause if any he can why Judgment shall not be rendered against him for the same and costs,

Plaintiffs Costs $15.80
A Copy att S, Noland, c, J, c, c,
